name: Power Outage Woes
title: Most Power Lost in Transmission
description: In 2022, Iraq experienced the highest electric power transmission and distribution losses in the world, with 59.25% of its output lost. This highlights significant inefficiencies in the country's power infrastructure.

name: Gift-Giving Governance
title: High Gift Expectations in Tax Meetings
description: In 2022, 51.2% of firms in Iraq reported expectations to give gifts during meetings with tax officials, indicating a prevalent culture of informal payments in the business environment.

name: Fuel-Driven Economy
title: Fuel Dominates Export Portfolio
description: In 2016, fuel exports constituted 99.99% of Iraq's merchandise exports, showcasing the country's heavy reliance on the oil sector for economic activity.

name: Revenue Reliance
title: Grants and Other Revenue Dominate
description: In 2019, grants and other revenue sources made up 96.52% of Iraq's total revenue, indicating a strong dependence on external financial support and non-tax revenue streams.

name: Financial Struggles
title: Negative Financial Flows
description: In 2022, Iraq experienced a net financial outflow of $293 million from IMF concessional sources, indicating financial challenges. Additionally, in 2021, the country saw a negative flow of $108,770 from UN agencies.

name: Debt Dilemma
title: High Liability Incurrence
description: In 2019, Iraq's net incurrence of liabilities reached a staggering -1,017 trillion LCU, highlighting significant debt challenges.

name: Minimal Social Safety
title: Low Social Contributions
description: Social contributions accounted for a mere 0.00045% of revenue in 2019, indicating limited social safety nets.

name: Taxation Troubles
title: Low Tax Revenue from Goods and Services
description: In 2019, taxes on goods and services contributed only 0.35% to revenue, reflecting inefficiencies in tax collection.

name: Interest Impact
title: Minimal Interest Payments
description: Interest payments represented just 0.58% of revenue and 0.82% of expenses in 2019, indicating low financial burdens from interest.

name: Business Challenges
title: Low Business Insolvency Scores
description: Iraq scored 6.74 in overall business insolvency and 20.22 in quality of regulations for judicial insolvency proceedings in 2024, highlighting regulatory challenges.

name: Banking Barriers
title: Limited Bank Financing for Firms
description: In 2022, only 2.1% of firms used banks for working capital, and 0.9% for investment, indicating limited access to bank financing.

name: Gender Gap
title: Low Female Participation in Business
description: In 2022, only 1.6% of firms had female top managers, and 3.8% had female ownership, indicating significant gender disparities in business leadership.

name: Youth Employment Struggles
title: Low Female Youth Employment
description: In 2021, the employment to population ratio for females aged 15-24 was just 2.58%, highlighting challenges in youth employment.

name: Tech Export Challenges
title: Minimal High-Tech Exports
description: In 2022, medium and high-tech exports constituted only 0.037% of manufactured exports, indicating a need for technological advancement.
